TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi sealed beforefieldinit FontStyle extends System.ValueType implements class System.IFormattable

Docs.summary: Defines a structure that represents the style of a font face as normal, italic, or oblique.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Three terms categorize the slant of a font: normal, italic, and oblique. |Font style|Description| |----------------|-----------------| |Normal|The characters in a normal, or roman, font are upright.| |Italic|The characters in an italic font are truly slanted and appear as they were designed.| |Oblique|The characters in an oblique font are artificially slanted. The slant is achieved by performing a shear transformation on the characters from a normal font. When a true italic font is not available on a computer or printer, an oblique style can generated from the normal font and used to simulate an italic font.| You can use the enumerated values of the class to set the FontStyle structure. ## XAML Attribute Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Values *fontStylesValue* A value, such as "Normal", "Italic", or "Oblique". ## Examples The following example sets `"Italic"` as the FontStyle. [!code-xml[FontSnippets#FontStyleSnippet5](../../add/codesnippet/Xaml/FontSnippets/FontStyleSnippets.xaml#fontstylesnippet5)]

Docs.returns: `true` to show the two instances are equal; otherwise, `false`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance string System.IFormattable.ToString(string format, class System.IFormatProvider provider) cil managed

Docs.param:
The <see cref="T:System.String"> specifying the format to use.
-or-
`null` to use the default format defined for the type of the <xref:System.IFormattable> implementation.

The <see cref="T:System.IFormatProvider"> to use to format the value.
-or-
`null` to obtain the numeric format information from the current locale setting of the operating system.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a <see cref="T:System.String"> that represents the current <xref:System.Windows.FontStyle> object and is based on the <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture%2A> property information.
Docs.returns: A <see cref="T:System.String"> that represents the value of the <xref:System.Windows.FontStyle> object, such as "Normal", "Italic", or "Oblique".
